title: Obamacare's Split Decisions Spell Law's Possible Return To Supreme Court
teaser: Two different U.S. appeals courts issued opposing verdicts on the Affordable Care Act, one striking down a crucial component of the law while another upheld the same component. NPR's Mara Liasson unravels the political consequences of the conflicting decisions.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
